direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods add text to an element, but prependText adds it at the beginning while appendText adds it at the end.
Both methods add content to an element, but prependText adds text specifically while append adds HTML content.
Both methods insert content at the beginning of an element, but prependText adds text while prepend adds HTML content.
Both methods insert a node at the beginning of an element, but prependText specifically adds a TextNode.
Both methods add content to an element, but prependText adds text while appendElement adds a new element.
Both methods insert content at the beginning of an element, but prependText adds text while prependElement adds a new element.
Both methods manipulate the text content of an element, but text replaces the existing content while prependText adds to the beginning.
Both methods manipulate the content of an element, but html replaces the existing HTML content while prependText adds text to the beginning.
Both methods insert content relative to the current element, but before inserts content before the element itself, not within it.
Both methods insert content relative to the current element, but after inserts content after the element itself, not within it.
